intro: Moraea stewartiae, commonly known as Stewart's moraea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped blooms in shades of red, orange, and yellow. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
